column4: Hi. I'm using vodafone mobile connect app in ubuntu 7.10. It works ok (sends sms) but no web access. etc/ppp/resolv.conf has wrong dns nameservers. Every time i replace for the correct ones, i get the wrong one back after reboot. any help?

evidently there is a DHCP client that rewrites '/etc/resolv.conf' with the numbers a DHCP server sends. Which means that either the Vodafone DHCP server sends out wrong values or there is another DHCP server.
well, you don't give any useful information, but to get that have a look at '/var/log/messages' and check what the DHCP client writes there.
